name: Comparative Literature BA
overview: This major develops the ability to analyze and situate literary texts in their aesthetic, historical, and cultural contexts; provides knowledge of different methods of literary analysis; and fosters skills in reading texts in two languages and writing structured analytic essays.

sections.title: Entry to the Major for Transfer Students
sections.description: Transfer applicants to the Comparative Literature major with 90 or more units must complete as many of the following introductory courses as possible prior to admission to UCLA. Refer to the UCLA transfer admission guide for up-to-date information regarding transfer selection for admission.

requirements.title: Literature Survey Courses
requirements.description: Complete two literature survey courses (at least one of which must be world literature).

requirements.title: Foreign Language
requirements.description: Complete the equivalent of at least one year of foreign language.

sections.title: Preparation for the Major
sections.description: Complete two courses, the College Writing requirement, and demonstrate literary proficiency in at least one language other than English as follows:

requirements.title: Comparative Literature
requirements.description: Select two courses from the following. With approval of the director of undergraduate studies, a comparable and appropriate lower-division course in another department may be substituted for one of the courses.

requirements.title: Literary Proficiency
requirements.description: Literary proficiency in at least one language other than English, to be demonstrated by admission into one upper-division literature course in the original language.

requirements.title: Upper-Division Comparative Literature
requirements.description: Select four courses from Comparative Literature M101 through 197.

requirements.title: Upper-Division Literature in Primary Language
requirements.description: Complete three upper-division literature courses using original language texts in the primary language area.

requirements.title: Upper-Division Literature in Secondary Language
requirements.description: Complete two upper-division literature courses using original language texts in the secondary language area. (Students may petition the student services adviser to take two upper-division literature courses in translation if their primary literature area is in a language other than English).

sections.title: Honors Program
sections.description: The departmental honors program is open to Comparative Literature majors with a 3.5 departmental and a 3.25 overall grade-point average. Eligible interested students should contact the student services adviser to enter the program.

requirements.title: Honors Program Requirements
requirements.description: Departmental honors candidates must complete all requirements for the major plus the following. Candidates complete an honors research paper in two of the four required upper-division comparative literature courses, a fourth course in the primary literature area, and the following course with a core faculty member, in which they write an independent research paper of approximately 25 pages:

options.title: Honors Research Papers
options.description: Complete an honors research paper (in addition to regular course requirements) in two of the four required upper-division comparative literature courses.

options.title: Additional Primary Language Course
options.description: Complete a fourth course in the primary literature area.
